Description: Fragmentary headress (kalathos) from a figure of Isis-Hathor, depicting the ureus (Wadjet) cobra (as Isis-Renenutet, herself wearing a sun disk between horns of Hathor) between the horns of Hathor. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Elaborate headress from a group of Isis-Hathor figures, probably produced in the Ptolemaic terracotta workshop at Naukratis (‘Site no. 95’ Egypt Exploration Fund, first season), but with parallels from across Egypt that are dated to the Ptolemaic and Roman periods (Ballet 2000, 184, no. 155; Breccia 1934, no. 11; Fischer 1994, no. 812; Dunand 1990, no. 329; no. 338; Hilton Price 1897, 400, no. 3316; Bailey 2008, 4; Petrie and Currelly 1905, 26-7; Nachtergael 1987, 240, pl. 2, fig. 3, pl. 1, fig. 2; Willems and Clarysse 2000, 247, no. 169; Nicholson 1968, no. 164). They are found from second century BC and the first half of the first century AD contexts at Athribis (Szymańska and Babraj 2004, 36, fig. 12; and Szymańska 2005, nos 28 and 34). Ballet, P. 2000, in Goyon, J-C (ed.), Coptos, l’Égypte antique aux portes du désert, Lyon. Breccia, E. 1934, Monuments de l’Égypte gréco-romaine II. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Higgins, R. A. 1967, Greek Terracottas, London. Hilton Price, F. G. 1897, A catalogue of the Egyptian Antiquities, London. Leonard, A. 2001, “Miscellaneous Material Culture”, in Leonard, A. (ed.) Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporium in Egypt II. The Excavations at Kom Hadid, AASOR 55, 164-220. Nachtergael, G. 1987, in S. Janeras (ed.), Miscellània papirològica Ramon Roca-Puig, Barcelona. Nicholson, F. 1968, Ancient life in miniature, Birmingham. Petrie, W.M.Fl., Currelly, C.T. 1905, Ehnasya 1904, London. (eds), 2000, Les empereurs du Nil, Leuven.
